org.microbean.servicebroker.api

Class CompositeServiceBroker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.servicebroker.api.ServiceBroker
      • org.microbean.servicebroker.api.CompositeServiceBroker

  • public class CompositeServiceBroker
extends ServiceBroker
    A ServiceBroker that multiplexes other ServiceBrokers.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    ServiceBroker

      • getParallelServiceDiscovery

        public boolean getParallelServiceDiscovery()
        Returns true if the getCatalog() method's internals should try to use parallel semantics when calling getCatalog() on all the ServiceBrokers this CompositeServiceBroker multiplexes.
        Returns:
        true if the getCatalog() method's internals should try to use parallel semantics when calling getCatalog() on all the ServiceBrokers this CompositeServiceBroker multiplexes; false otherwise
        See Also:
        setParallelServiceDiscovery(boolean), getCatalog()

      • setParallelServiceDiscovery

        public void setParallelServiceDiscovery(boolean parallelServiceDiscovery)
        Sets whether the getCatalog() method's internals should try to use parallel semantics when calling getCatalog() on all the ServiceBrokers this CompositeServiceBroker multiplexes.
        Parameters:
        parallelServiceDiscovery - if true, then the getCatalog() method's internals will try to use parallel semantics when calling getCatalog() on all the ServiceBrokers this CompositeServiceBroker multiplexes
        See Also:
        getParallelServiceDiscovery(), getCatalog()

      • addServiceBroker

        public final boolean addServiceBroker(@NotNull
                                      @NotNull ServiceBroker serviceBroker)
        Calls the handleAddServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) method supplying it the supplied serviceBroker and returns the result.

        This method acquires and properly releases a write lock internally that ensures that overrides of the handleAddServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) method do not have to worry about concurrency concerns, particularly while a getCatalog() invocation is in process.

        Parameters:
        serviceBroker - the ServiceBroker to add; must not be null
        Returns:
        true if the supplied ServiceBroker was added; false otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if serviceBroker was null
        See Also:
        handleAddServiceBroker(ServiceBroker)

      • handleAddServiceBroker

        protected boolean handleAddServiceBroker(@NotNull
                                         @NotNull ServiceBroker serviceBroker)

      • removeServiceBroker

        public final boolean removeServiceBroker(@NotNull
                                         @NotNull ServiceBroker serviceBroker)
        Calls the handleRemoveServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) method supplying it the supplied serviceBroker and returns the result.

        This method first calls the removeServices(ServiceBroker) method supplying it the ServiceBroker that has just been removed, also with proper concurrency semantics.

        This method acquires and properly releases a write lock internally that ensures that overrides of the handleRemoveServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) method do not have to worry about concurrency concerns, particularly while a getCatalog() invocation is in process.

        Parameters:
        serviceBroker - the ServiceBroker to remove; must not be null
        Returns:
        true if the supplied ServiceBroker was removeed; false otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if serviceBroker was null
        See Also:
        handleRemoveServiceBroker(ServiceBroker), removeServices(ServiceBroker)

      • handleRemoveServiceBroker

        protected boolean handleRemoveServiceBroker(@NotNull
                                            @NotNull ServiceBroker serviceBroker)

      • getServiceBrokers

        public final Set<ServiceBroker> getServiceBrokers()

      • handleGetServiceBrokers

        protected Set<ServiceBroker> handleGetServiceBrokers()
        Returns a Set of ServiceBrokers that semantically was built up as a result of addServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) and removeServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) operations.

        Implementations of this method may return null.

        Modifications to the Set returned by this method must not be made by any mechanism other than that implemented by the handleRemoveServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) and handleAddServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) methods, or a ConcurrentModificationException may be thrown by the default implementation of the getCatalog() method.

        This method is called by the getServiceBrokers() method. Calling this method in any other fashion may result in undefined behavior.

        Overrides of this method must not call the getServiceBrokers() method or a StackOverflowError may result.

        Returns:
        a Set of ServiceBroker instances, or null
        See Also:
        getServiceBrokers(), getCatalog()

      • removeServices

        protected void removeServices()
        Effectively removes all Catalog.Services from this CompositeServiceBroker during a getCatalog() operation while they are being recalculated.

        This method is called by the getCatalog() method. Calling this method in any other fashion may result in undefined behavior.

        Overrides of this method must not call the getCatalog() method or a StackOverflowError may result.

        See Also:
        removeServices(ServiceBroker)

      • removeServices

        protected void removeServices(@NotNull
                              @NotNull ServiceBroker serviceBroker)
        Effectively emoves all Catalog.Services associated with the supplied ServiceBroker from being visible or known about in any way by this CompositeServiceBroker during an invocation of the removeServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) method immediately before the supplied ServiceBroker is removed from this CompositeServiceBroker by the handleRemoveServiceBroker(ServiceBroker) method.

        Overrides of this method must not call the following methods, or undefined behavior may result:

        • removeServiceBroker(ServiceBroker)
        • handleAddServiceBroker(ServiceBroker)
        • handleRemoveServiceBroker(ServiceBroker)
        • putServiceBrokerForServiceId(String, ServiceBroker)
        Parameters:
        serviceBroker - the ServiceBroker whose logical Catalog.Service entries should be logically removed from this CompositeServiceBroker; must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if serviceBroker is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if serviceBroker is this CompositeServiceBroker

      • getServiceBrokerForServiceId

        protected ServiceBroker getServiceBrokerForServiceId(@NotEmpty
                                                     @NotEmpty String serviceId)
        Returns the ServiceBroker logically responsible for the logical Catalog.Service identified by the supplied serviceId, or null if no such ServiceBroker exists.

        This method may return null.

        Overrides of this method may return null.

        Parameters:
        serviceId - an identifier of a Catalog.Service; must not be null
        Returns:
        the ServiceBroker logically responsible for the logical Catalog.Service identified by the supplied serviceId, or null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if serviceId is null

      • putServiceBrokerForServiceId

        protected ServiceBroker putServiceBrokerForServiceId(@NotEmpty
                                                     @NotEmpty String serviceId,
                                                     @NotNull
                                                     @NotNull ServiceBroker serviceBroker)
        Records an association between a Catalog.Service (represented here by the serviceId parameter) and the ServiceBroker responsible for it, and returns any ServiceBroker previously responsible for the association.

        This method may return null (and in fact should).

        Overrides of this method may return null (and in fact should).

        Parameters:
        serviceId - the identifier of a Service; must not be null
        serviceBroker - the ServiceBroker that is responsible for the Catalog.Service whose identifier is the value of the serviceId parameter; must not be null
        Returns:
        the ServiceBroker that was previously linked; null in most if not all cases
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either serviceId or serviceBroker is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if serviceBroker is this very CompositeServiceBroker

      • getCatalog

        @NotNull
protected @NotNull Catalog getCatalog(@NotNull
                                               @NotNull ServiceBroker serviceBroker)
                                        throws ServiceBrokerException
        Returns a Catalog for the given ServiceBroker.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        The default implementation of this method simply calls the ServiceBroker.getCatalog() method on the supplied serviceBroker and returns it. Overrides may wish to do additional processing or logging of this call.

        Parameters:
        serviceBroker - the ServiceBroker whose catalog should be returned; must not be null
        Returns:
        a non-null Catalog, normally as a result of calling the ServiceBroker.getCatalog() method on the supplied ServiceBroker
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if serviceBroker is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if serviceBroker is this very CompositeServiceBroker
        ServiceBrokerException - if any other error occurs
        See Also:
        ServiceBroker.getCatalog()

      • getCatalog

        @NotNull
public final @NotNull Catalog getCatalog()
                                           throws ServiceBrokerException
        Returns a Catalog that represents the logical union of all the Catalog instances from all the ServiceBrokers that are multiplexed by this CompositeServiceBroker.

        This method never returns null.

        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

        The implementation of this method is governed by the return value of the getParallelServiceDiscovery() method: if true, then the ServiceBrokers that this CompositeServiceBroker multiplexes are consulted for their Catalog instances in parallel.

        Throughout the implementation of this method, appropriate locking semantics are used such that overrides of the various protected methods in this class do not have to synchronize or otherwise guard against concurrent access.

        Specified by:
        getCatalog in class ServiceBroker
        Returns:
        a non-null Catalog
        Throws:
        ServiceBrokerException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        getServiceBrokers(), getParallelServiceDiscovery(), getCatalog(ServiceBroker), putServiceBrokerForServiceId(String, ServiceBroker), removeServices()
